posts.post_content:
I don't really see anything wrong with it. If you end up with a bad hand with a lot of extra mana this can really pull it's weight. The fact that you can use it as an instant to leave open mana for a counterspell is wonderful, too.  
  
It isn't competitive, sure, but there are different formats for a reason.

Rating:

posts.post_content:
ALL the draw cards in this set suck. I've been looking for a good one, but this looks like it's going to be a VERY slow block. This card is pretty decent compared to the other stuff. The only two substitutes are [Viridian Revel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viridian Revel) and [Culling Dais](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Culling Dais). [Infiltration Lens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infiltration Lens) is unreliable, but it can made to work if with an aura or two. Those are all horrible draw cards, but they're the most effective. Compare them to this.  
  
4/5 One of the best draw cards in the set where card advantage is really hard to get.
posts.html:

Posted By: Scormio (3/25/2012 12:06:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: One card for 7 mana... two cards for 9, or three cards for 11. Even at its best (the last draw), you're still paying 3.6 mana per draw. And then after that, you're paying an additional 4 for each draw. Putting a charge counter on it: four cards for 15 mana -- 3.75 mana per card, and each new charge put on it increases the average cost per card higher and higher toward 4 per card. That's brutally expensive.
posts.html:
